00020 
00021 template<typename eT>
00022 inline
00023 Cube<eT>::~Cube()
00024   {
00025   arma_extra_debug_sigprint_this(this);
00026   
00027   delete_mat();
00028   
00029   if(use_aux_mem == false)
00030     {
00031     if(n_elem > sizeof(mem_local)/sizeof(eT) )
00032       {
00033       delete [] mem;
00034       }
00035     }
00036     
00037   if(arma_config::debug == true)
00038     {
00039     // try to expose buggy user code that accesses deleted objects
00040     access::rw(n_rows)       = 0;
00041     access::rw(n_cols)       = 0;
00042     access::rw(n_elem_slice) = 0;
00043     access::rw(n_slices)     = 0;
00044     access::rw(n_elem)       = 0;
00045     access::rw(mat_ptrs)     = 0;
00046     access::rw(mem)          = 0;
00047     }
00048   
00049   isnt_supported_elem_type<eT>::check();
00050   }
00051

00061   , n_elem(0)

00071 //! construct the cube to have user specified dimensions
00072 template<typename eT>
00073 inline
00074 Cube<eT>::Cube(const u32 in_n_rows, const u32 in_n_cols, const u32 in_n_slices)

00076   , n_cols(0)
00077   , n_elem_slice(0)
00078   , n_slices(0)
00079   , n_elem(0)
00080   , use_aux_mem(false)
00081   , mat_ptrs(mat_ptrs)
00082   , mem(mem)

00085   
00086   init(in_n_rows, in_n_cols, in_n_slices);

00090 
00091 //! internal cube construction; if the requested size is small enough, memory from the stack is used.
00092 //! otherwise memory is allocated via 'new'
00093 template<typename eT>
00094 inline
00095 void
00096 Cube<eT>::init(const u32 in_n_rows, const u32 in_n_cols, const u32 in_n_slices)
00097   {
00098   arma_extra_debug_sigprint( arma_boost::format("in_n_rows = %d, in_n_cols = %d, in_n_slices = %d") % in_n_rows % in_n_cols % in_n_slices );
00099   
00100   const u32 new_n_elem = in_n_rows * in_n_cols * in_n_slices;
00101 
00102   if(n_elem == new_n_elem)
00103     {
00104     if( (n_rows != in_n_rows) || (n_cols != in_n_cols) || (n_slices != in_n_slices) )
00105       {
00106       delete_mat();
00107 
00108       access::rw(n_rows)       = in_n_rows;
00109       access::rw(n_cols)       = in_n_cols;
00110       access::rw(n_elem_slice) = in_n_rows*in_n_cols;
00111       access::rw(n_slices)     = in_n_slices;
00112     
00113       create_mat();
00114       }
00115     }
00116   else
00117     {
00118     arma_debug_check
00119       (
00120       (use_aux_mem == true),
00121       "Cube::init(): can't change the amount of memory as auxiliary memory is in use"
00122       );
00123       
00124     delete_mat();
00125 
00126     if(n_elem > sizeof(mem_local)/sizeof(eT) )
00127       {
00128       delete [] mem;
00129       }
00130     
00131     if(new_n_elem <= sizeof(mem_local)/sizeof(eT) )
00132       {
00133       access::rw(mem) = mem_local;
00134       }
00135     else
00136       {
00137       access::rw(mem) = new(std::nothrow) eT[new_n_elem];
00138       arma_check( (mem == 0), "Cube::init(): out of memory" );
00139       }
00140     
00141     access::rw(n_elem) = new_n_elem;
00142 
00143     if(new_n_elem == 0)
00144       {
00145       access::rw(n_rows)       = 0;
00146       access::rw(n_cols)       = 0;
00147       access::rw(n_elem_slice) = 0;
00148       access::rw(n_slices)     = 0;
00149       }
00150     else
00151       {
00152       access::rw(n_rows)       = in_n_rows;
00153       access::rw(n_cols)       = in_n_cols;
00154       access::rw(n_elem_slice) = in_n_rows*in_n_cols;
00155       access::rw(n_slices)     = in_n_slices;
00156       }
00157       
00158     create_mat();
00159     }
00160   }
00161 
00162 
00163 template<typename eT>
00164 inline
00165 void
00166 Cube<eT>::delete_mat()
00167   {
00168   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00169   
00170   for(u32 slice = 0; slice < n_slices; ++slice)
00171     {
00172     delete access::rw(mat_ptrs[slice]);
00173     }
00174 
00175   if(n_slices > sizeof(mat_ptrs_local)/sizeof(Mat<eT>*) )
00176     {
00177     delete [] mat_ptrs;
00178     }
00179   }
00180 
00181 
00182 
00183 template<typename eT>
00184 inline
00185 void
00186 Cube<eT>::create_mat()
00187   {
00188   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00189 
00190   if( n_slices <= sizeof(mat_ptrs_local)/sizeof(Mat<eT>*) )
00191     {
00192     access::rw(mat_ptrs) = const_cast< const Mat<eT>** >(mat_ptrs_local);
00193     }
00194   else
00195     {
00196     access::rw(mat_ptrs) = new(std::nothrow) const Mat<eT>*[n_slices];
00197     arma_check( (mat_ptrs == 0), "Cube::create_mat(): out of memory" );
00198     }
00199     
00200   for(u32 slice = 0; slice < n_slices; ++slice)
00201     {
00202     mat_ptrs[slice] = new Mat<eT>('j', slice_memptr(slice), n_rows, n_cols);
00203     }
00204   }

00208 //! Set the cube to be equal to the specified scalar.
00209 //! NOTE: the size of the cube will be 1x1x1
00210 template<typename eT>
00211 arma_inline
00212 const Cube<eT>&
00213 Cube<eT>::operator=(const eT val)
00214   {
00215   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00216   
00217   init(1,1,1);
00218   access::rw(mem[0]) = val;
00219   return *this;
00220   }

00225 template<typename eT>
00226 arma_inline
00227 const Cube<eT>&
00228 Cube<eT>::operator+=(const eT val)
00229   {
00230   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00231   
00232   for(u32 i=0; i<n_elem; ++i)
00233     {
00234     access::rw(mem[i]) += val;
00235     }
00236   
00237   return *this;
00238   }

00246 Cube<eT>::operator-=(const eT val)

00248   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();

00255   return *this;

00300   : n_rows(0)
00301   , n_cols(0)
00302   , n_elem_slice(0)
00303   , n_slices(0)

00306   , mat_ptrs(mat_ptrs)
00307   , mem(mem)
00308   {

00312   }

00330 //! construct a cube from a given cube
00331 template<typename eT>
00332 inline
00333 void
00334 Cube<eT>::init(const Cube<eT>& x)
00335   {
00336   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00337   
00338   if(this != &x)
00339     {
00340     init(x.n_rows, x.n_cols, x.n_slices);
00341     syslib::copy_elem( memptr(), x.mem, n_elem );
00342     }
00343   }

00346 
00347 //! construct a cube from a given auxiliary array of eTs.
00348 //! if copy_aux_mem is true, new memory is allocated and the array is copied.
00349 //! if copy_aux_mem is false, the auxiliary array is used directly (without allocating memory and copying).
00350 //! note that in the latter case 
00351 //! the default is to copy the array.
00352 
00353 template<typename eT>
00354 inline
00355 Cube<eT>::Cube(eT* aux_mem, const u32 aux_n_rows, const u32 aux_n_cols, const u32 aux_n_slices, const bool copy_aux_mem)
00356   : n_rows      (copy_aux_mem ? 0     : aux_n_rows                        )
00357   , n_cols      (copy_aux_mem ? 0     : aux_n_cols                        )
00358   , n_elem_slice(copy_aux_mem ? 0     : aux_n_rows*aux_n_cols             )
00359   , n_slices    (copy_aux_mem ? 0     : aux_n_slices                      )
00360   , n_elem      (copy_aux_mem ? 0     : aux_n_rows*aux_n_cols*aux_n_slices)
00361   , use_aux_mem (copy_aux_mem ? false : true                              )
00362   , mat_ptrs    (mat_ptrs                                                 )
00363   , mem         (copy_aux_mem ? mem   : aux_mem                           )
00364   {
00365   arma_extra_debug_sigprint_this(this);
00366   
00367   if(copy_aux_mem == true)
00368     {
00369     init(aux_n_rows, aux_n_cols, aux_n_slices);
00370     syslib::copy_elem( memptr(), aux_mem, n_elem );
00371     }
00372   else
00373     {
00374     create_mat();
00375     }
00376   }
00377

00380 //! construct a cube from a given auxiliary read-only array of eTs.
00381 //! the array is copied.
00382 template<typename eT>
00383 inline
00384 Cube<eT>::Cube(const eT* aux_mem, const u32 aux_n_rows, const u32 aux_n_cols, const u32 aux_n_slices)

00386   , n_cols(0)
00387   , n_elem_slice(0)
00388   , n_slices(0)

00402 //! in-place cube addition
00403 template<typename eT>
00404 inline
00405 const Cube<eT>&
00406 Cube<eT>::operator+=(const Cube<eT>& m)
00407   {
00408   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00409   
00410   arma_debug_assert_same_size(*this, m, "cube addition");
00411   
00412         eT* out_mem      = (*this).memptr();
00413   const eT* m_mem        = m.memptr();
00414   const u32 local_n_elem = m.n_elem;
00415   
00416   for(u32 i=0; i<local_n_elem; ++i)
00417     {
00418     out_mem[i] += m_mem[i];
00419     }
00420   
00421   return *this;
00422   }

00430 Cube<eT>::operator-=(const Cube<eT>& m)
00431   {
00432   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();

00435   
00436         eT* out_mem      = (*this).memptr();
00437   const eT* m_mem        = m.memptr();
00438   const u32 local_n_elem = m.n_elem;
00439   
00440   for(u32 i=0; i<local_n_elem; ++i)
00441     {
00442     out_mem[i] -= m_mem[i];
00443     }
00444   
00445   return *this;
00446   }

00451 template<typename eT>

00453 const Cube<eT>&
00454 Cube<eT>::operator%=(const Cube<eT>& m)
00455   {
00456   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00457   
00458   arma_debug_assert_same_size(*this, m, "element-wise cube multiplication");
00459   
00460         eT* out_mem      = (*this).memptr();
00461   const eT* m_mem        = m.memptr();

00463

00465     {

00497 
00498 //! for constructing a complex cube out of two non-complex cubes
00499 template<typename eT>
00500 template<typename T1, typename T2>
00501 inline
00502 Cube<eT>::Cube
00503   (
00504   const BaseCube<typename Cube<eT>::pod_type,T1>& A,
00505   const BaseCube<typename Cube<eT>::pod_type,T2>& B
00506   )
00507   : n_rows(0)
00508   , n_cols(0)
00509   , n_elem_slice(0)
00510   , n_slices(0)
00511   , n_elem(0)
00512   , use_aux_mem(false)
00513   , mat_ptrs(mat_ptrs)
00514   , mem(mem)
00515   {
00516   arma_extra_debug_sigprint_this(this);
00517   
00518   arma_type_check< is_complex<eT>::value == false >::apply();   //!< compile-time abort if eT isn't std::complex
00519   
00520   typedef typename T1::elem_type T;
00521   arma_type_check< is_complex<T>::value == true >::apply();   //!< compile-time abort if T is std::complex
00522   
00523   isnt_same_type<std::complex<T>, eT>::check();   //!< compile-time abort if types are not compatible
00524   
00525   const unwrap_cube<T1> tmp_A(A.get_ref());
00526   const unwrap_cube<T2> tmp_B(B.get_ref());
00527   
00528   const Cube<T>& X = tmp_A.M;
00529   const Cube<T>& Y = tmp_B.M;
00530   
00531   arma_assert_same_size(X, Y, "Cube()");
00532   
00533   init(X.n_rows, X.n_cols, X.n_slices);
00534   
00535   const T* X_mem = X.mem;
00536   const T* Y_mem = Y.mem;
00537   
00538   for(u32 i=0; i<n_elem; ++i)
00539     {
00540     access::rw(mem[i]) = std::complex<T>(X_mem[i], Y_mem[i]);
00541     }
00542   }

00550   : n_rows(0)
00551   , n_cols(0)
00552   , n_elem_slice(0)
00553   , n_slices(0)
00554   , n_elem(0)

00556   , mat_ptrs(mat_ptrs)
00557   , mem(mem)
00558   {
00559   arma_extra_debug_sigprint_this(this);
00560   
00561   this->operator=(X);
00562   }

00636 //! provide the reference to the matrix representing a single slice
00637 template<typename eT>
00638 arma_inline
00639 Mat<eT>&
00640 Cube<eT>::slice(const u32 in_slice)
00641   {
00642   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00643   
00644   arma_debug_check
00645     (
00646     (in_slice >= n_slices),
00647     "Cube::slice(): index out of bounds"
00648     );
00649   
00650   return const_cast< Mat<eT>& >( *(mat_ptrs[in_slice]) );
00651   }

00673 
00674 //! creation of subview_cube (subcube comprised of specified slices)
00675 template<typename eT>
00676 arma_inline
00677 subview_cube<eT>
00678 Cube<eT>::slices(const u32 in_slice1, const u32 in_slice2)
00679   {
00680   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00681   
00682   arma_debug_check
00683     (
00684     (in_slice1 > in_slice2) || (in_slice2 >= n_slices),
00685     "Cube::slices(): indices out of bounds or incorrectly used"
00686     );
00687   
00688   return subview_cube<eT>(*this, 0, 0, in_slice1, ( (n_rows>0) ? n_rows-1 : 0 ), ( (n_cols>0) ? n_cols-1 : 0 ), in_slice2);
00689   }

00691 
00692 
00693 //! creation of subview_cube (subcube comprised of specified slices)
00694 template<typename eT>
00695 arma_inline
00696 const subview_cube<eT>
00697 Cube<eT>::slices(const u32 in_slice1, const u32 in_slice2) const
00698   {
00699   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00700   
00701   arma_debug_check
00702     (
00703     (in_slice1 > in_slice2) || (in_slice2 >= n_slices),
00704     "Cube::rows(): indices out of bounds or incorrectly used"
00705     );
00706   
00707   return subview_cube<eT>(*this, 0, 0, in_slice1, ( (n_rows>0) ? n_rows-1 : 0 ), ( (n_cols>0) ? n_cols-1 : 0 ), in_slice2);
00708   }
00709 
00710 
00711 
00712 //! creation of subview_cube (generic subcube)
00713 template<typename eT>
00714 arma_inline
00715 subview_cube<eT>
00716 Cube<eT>::subcube(const u32 in_row1, const u32 in_col1, const u32 in_slice1, const u32 in_row2, const u32 in_col2, const u32 in_slice2)
00717   {
00718   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00719   
00720   arma_debug_check
00721     (
00722     (in_row1 >  in_row2) || (in_col1 >  in_col2) || (in_slice1 >  in_slice2) ||
00723     (in_row2 >= n_rows)  || (in_col2 >= n_cols)  || (in_slice2 >= n_slices),
00724     "Cube::subcube(): indices out of bounds or incorrectly used"
00725     );
00726   
00727   return subview_cube<eT>(*this, in_row1, in_col1, in_slice1, in_row2, in_col2, in_slice2);
00728   }
00729 
00730 
00731 
00732 //! creation of subview_cube (generic subcube)
00733 template<typename eT>
00734 arma_inline
00735 const subview_cube<eT>
00736 Cube<eT>::subcube(const u32 in_row1, const u32 in_col1, const u32 in_slice1, const u32 in_row2, const u32 in_col2, const u32 in_slice2) const
00737   {
00738   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00739   
00740   arma_debug_check
00741     (
00742     (in_row1 >  in_row2) || (in_col1 >  in_col2) || (in_slice1 >  in_slice2) ||
00743     (in_row2 >= n_rows)  || (in_col2 >= n_cols)  || (in_slice2 >= n_slices),
00744     "Cube::subcube(): indices out of bounds or incorrectly used"
00745     );
00746     
00747   return subview_cube<eT>(*this, in_row1, in_col1, in_slice1, in_row2, in_col2, in_slice2);
00748   }

00753 template<typename eT>
00754 template<typename T1, typename op_type>
00755 inline
00756 Cube<eT>::Cube(const OpCube<T1, op_type>& X)
00757   : n_rows(0)
00758   , n_cols(0)
00759   , n_elem_slice(0)
00760   , n_slices(0)
00761   , n_elem(0)
00762   , use_aux_mem(false)
00763   , mat_ptrs(mat_ptrs)
00764   , mem(mem)
00765   {
00766   arma_extra_debug_sigprint_this(this);
00767 
00768   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T1::elem_type>::check();
00769   
00770   op_type::apply(*this, X);
00771   }

00778 inline
00779 const Cube<eT>&
00780 Cube<eT>::operator=(const OpCube<T1, op_type>& X)
00781   {
00782   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00783 
00784   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T1::elem_type>::check();
00785

00787

00789   }

00792 
00793 //! in-place cube addition, with the right-hand-side operand having delayed operations
00794 template<typename eT>
00795 template<typename T1, typename op_type>
00796 inline
00797 const Cube<eT>&
00798 Cube<eT>::operator+=(const OpCube<T1, op_type>& X)
00799   {
00800   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00801   
00802   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T1::elem_type>::check();
00803   
00804   const Cube<eT> m(X);
00805   
00806   arma_debug_assert_same_size(*this, m, "cube addition");
00807   
00808         eT* out_mem      = (*this).memptr();
00809   const eT* m_mem        = m.memptr();
00810   const u32 local_n_elem = m.n_elem;
00811   
00812   for(u32 i=0; i<local_n_elem; ++i)
00813     {
00814     out_mem[i] += m_mem[i];
00815     }
00816   
00817   return *this;
00818   }
00819

00822 //! in-place cube subtraction, with the right-hand-side operand having delayed operations
00823 template<typename eT>
00824 template<typename T1, typename op_type>
00825 inline
00826 const Cube<eT>&
00827 Cube<eT>::operator-=(const OpCube<T1, op_type>& X)
00828   {
00829   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00830   
00831   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T1::elem_type>::check();
00832   
00833   const Cube<eT> m(X);
00834   
00835   arma_debug_assert_same_size(*this, m, "cube subtraction");
00836   
00837         eT* out_mem      = (*this).memptr();
00838   const eT* m_mem        = m.memptr();
00839   const u32 local_n_elem = m.n_elem;
00840   
00841   for(u32 i=0; i<local_n_elem; ++i)
00842     {
00843     out_mem[i] -= m_mem[i];
00844     }
00845   
00846   return *this;
00847   }

01338 
01339 //! element accessor; bounds checking not done when ARMA_NO_DEBUG is defined
01340 template<typename eT>
01341 arma_inline
01342 eT&
01343 Cube<eT>::operator() (const u32 in_row, const u32 in_col, const u32 in_slice)
01344   {
01345   arma_debug_check
01346     (
01347     (in_row >= n_rows) ||
01348     (in_col >= n_cols) ||
01349     (in_slice >= n_slices)
01350     ,
01351     "Cube::operator(): index out of bounds"
01352     );
01353 
01354   return access::rw(mem[in_slice*n_elem_slice + in_col*n_rows + in_row]);
01355   }
01356 
01357 
01358 
01359 //! element accessor; bounds checking not done when ARMA_NO_DEBUG is defined
01360 template<typename eT>
01361 arma_inline
01362 eT
01363 Cube<eT>::operator() (const u32 in_row, const u32 in_col, const u32 in_slice) const
01364   {
01365   arma_debug_check
01366     (
01367     (in_row >= n_rows) ||
01368     (in_col >= n_cols) ||
01369     (in_slice >= n_slices)
01370     ,
01371     "Cube::operator(): index out of bounds"
01372     );
01373 
01374   return mem[in_slice*n_elem_slice + in_col*n_rows + in_row];
01375   }
01376 
01377 
01378 
01379 //! element accessor; no bounds check
01380 template<typename eT>
01381 arma_inline
01382 eT&
01383 Cube<eT>::at(const u32 in_row, const u32 in_col, const u32 in_slice)
01384   {
01385   return access::rw( mem[in_slice*n_elem_slice + in_col*n_rows + in_row] );
01386   }
01387 
01388 
01389 
01390 //! element accessor; no bounds check
01391 template<typename eT>
01392 arma_inline
01393 eT
01394 Cube<eT>::at(const u32 in_row, const u32 in_col, const u32 in_slice) const
01395   {
01396   return mem[in_slice*n_elem_slice + in_col*n_rows + in_row];
01397   }

01401 //! prefix ++
01402 template<typename eT>
01403 arma_inline
01404 const Cube<eT>&
01405 Cube<eT>::operator++()
01406   {
01407   Cube_aux::prefix_pp(*this);
01408   return *this;
01409   }

01412 
01413 //! postfix ++  (must not return the object by reference)
01414 template<typename eT>
01415 arma_inline
01416 void
01417 Cube<eT>::operator++(int)
01418   {
01419   Cube_aux::postfix_pp(*this);
01420   }

01432   }

01437 template<typename eT>

01441   {
01442   Cube_aux::postfix_mm(*this);
01443   }

01446 
01447 //! returns true if all of the elements are finite
01448 template<typename eT>
01449 arma_inline
01450 bool
01451 Cube<eT>::is_finite() const
01452   {
01453   for(u32 i=0; i<n_elem; ++i)
01454     {
01455     if(arma_isfinite(mem[i]) == false)
01456       {
01457       return false;
01458       }
01459     }
01460 
01461   return true;
01462   }

01532 //! print contents of the cube (to the cout stream),
01533 //! optionally preceding with a user specified line of text.
01534 //! the precision and cell width are modified.
01535 //! on return, the stream's flags are restored to their original values.
01536 template<typename eT>
01537 inline
01538 void
01539 Cube<eT>::print(const std::string extra_text) const
01540   {
01541   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01542   
01543   if(extra_text.length() != 0)
01544     {
01545     cout << extra_text << '\n';
01546     }
01547   
01548   arma_ostream::print(cout, *this, true);
01549   }
01550 
01551 
01552 //! print contents of the cube to a user specified stream,
01553 //! optionally preceding with a user specified line of text.
01554 //! the precision and cell width are modified.
01555 //! on return, the stream's flags are restored to their original values.
01556 template<typename eT>
01557 inline
01558 void
01559 Cube<eT>::print(std::ostream& user_stream, const std::string extra_text) const
01560   {
01561   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01562   
01563   if(extra_text.length() != 0)
01564     {
01565     user_stream << extra_text << '\n';
01566     }
01567   
01568   arma_ostream::print(user_stream, *this, true);
01569   }
01570 
01571 
01572 
01573 //! print contents of the cube (to the cout stream),
01574 //! optionally preceding with a user specified line of text.
01575 //! the stream's flags are used as is and are not modified
01576 //! (i.e. the precision and cell width are not modified).
01577 template<typename eT>
01578 inline
01579 void
01580 Cube<eT>::raw_print(const std::string extra_text) const
01581   {
01582   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01583   
01584   if(extra_text.length() != 0)
01585     {
01586     cout << extra_text << '\n';
01587     }
01588   
01589   arma_ostream::print(cout, *this, false);
01590   }

01594 //! print contents of the cube to a user specified stream,
01595 //! optionally preceding with a user specified line of text.
01596 //! the stream's flags are used as is and are not modified.
01597 //! (i.e. the precision and cell width are not modified).
01598 template<typename eT>
01599 inline
01600 void
01601 Cube<eT>::raw_print(std::ostream& user_stream, const std::string extra_text) const
01602   {

01606     {
01607     user_stream << extra_text << '\n';
01608     }
01609   
01610   arma_ostream::print(user_stream, *this, false);
01611   }

01618 void
01619 Cube<eT>::set_size(const u32 in_n_rows, const u32 in_n_cols, const u32 in_n_slices)

01622   
01623   init(in_n_rows, in_n_cols, in_n_slices);
01624   }

01633 Cube<eT>::copy_size(const Cube<eT2>& m)
01634   {

01636   
01637   init(m.n_rows, m.n_cols, m.n_slices);

01641 
01642 //! fill the cube with the specified value
01643 template<typename eT>
01644 inline
01645 void
01646 Cube<eT>::fill(const eT val)
01647   {
01648   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01649   
01650   for(u32 i=0; i<n_elem; ++i)
01651     {
01652     access::rw(mem[i]) = val;
01653     }
01654   }

01666   }

01670 template<typename eT>
01671 inline
01672 void
01673 Cube<eT>::zeros(const u32 in_rows, const u32 in_cols, const u32 in_slices)
01674   {
01675   arma_extra_debug_sigprint( arma_boost::format("in_rows = %d, in_cols = %d, in_slices = %d") % in_rows % in_cols % in_slices );
01676 
01677   set_size(in_rows, in_cols, in_slices);
01678   fill(eT(0));
01679   }

01701

01718 
01719 
01720 //! save the cube to a file
01721 template<typename eT>
01722 inline
01723 void
01724 Cube<eT>::save(const std::string name, const file_type type) const
01725   {
01726   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01727   
01728   switch(type)
01729     {
01730     case raw_ascii:
01731       diskio::save_raw_ascii(*this, name);
01732       break;
01733     
01734     case arma_ascii:
01735       diskio::save_arma_ascii(*this, name);
01736       break;
01737     
01738     case arma_binary:
01739       diskio::save_arma_binary(*this, name);
01740       break;
01741       
01742     case ppm_binary:
01743       diskio::save_ppm_binary(*this, name);
01744       break;
01745 
01746     default:
01747       arma_stop("Cube::save(): unsupported file type");
01748     }
01749   
01750   }
01751 
01752 
01753 
01754 //! save the cube to a stream
01755 template<typename eT>
01756 inline
01757 void
01758 Cube<eT>::save(std::ostream& os, const file_type type) const
01759   {
01760   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01761   
01762   switch(type)
01763     {
01764     case raw_ascii:
01765       diskio::save_raw_ascii(*this, "[ostream]", os);
01766       break;
01767     
01768     case arma_ascii:
01769       diskio::save_arma_ascii(*this, "[ostream]", os);
01770       break;
01771     
01772     case arma_binary:
01773       diskio::save_arma_binary(*this, "[ostream]", os);
01774       break;
01775       
01776     case ppm_binary:
01777       diskio::save_ppm_binary(*this, "[ostream]", os);
01778       break;
01779 
01780     default:
01781       arma_stop("Cube::save(): unsupported file type");
01782     }
01783   
01784   }
01785

01787 
01788 //! load a cube from a file
01789 template<typename eT>
01790 inline
01791 void
01792 Cube<eT>::load(const std::string name, const file_type type)
01793   {
01794   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01795   
01796   switch(type)
01797     {
01798     case auto_detect:
01799       diskio::load_auto_detect(*this, name);
01800       break;
01801     
01802     case raw_ascii:
01803       diskio::load_raw_ascii(*this, name);
01804       break;
01805     
01806     case arma_ascii:
01807       diskio::load_arma_ascii(*this, name);
01808       break;
01809     
01810     case arma_binary:
01811       diskio::load_arma_binary(*this, name);
01812       break;
01813       
01814     case ppm_binary:
01815       diskio::load_ppm_binary(*this, name);
01816       break;
01817 
01818     default:
01819       arma_stop("Cube::load(): unsupported file type");
01820     }
01821   
01822   }
01823

01825 
01826 //! load a cube from a stream
01827 template<typename eT>
01828 inline
01829 void
01830 Cube<eT>::load(std::istream& is, const file_type type)
01831   {
01832   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01833   
01834   switch(type)
01835     {
01836     case auto_detect:
01837       diskio::load_auto_detect(*this, "[istream]", is);
01838       break;
01839     
01840     case raw_ascii:
01841       diskio::load_raw_ascii(*this, "[istream]", is);
01842       break;
01843     
01844     case arma_ascii:
01845       diskio::load_arma_ascii(*this, "[istream]", is);
01846       break;
01847     
01848     case arma_binary:
01849       diskio::load_arma_binary(*this, "[istream]", is);
01850       break;
01851       
01852     case ppm_binary:
01853       diskio::load_ppm_binary(*this, "[istream]", is);
01854       break;
01855     
01856     default:
01857       arma_stop("Cube::load(): unsupported file type");
01858     }
01859   
01860   }

01863 
01864 //! prefix ++
01865 template<typename eT>
01866 arma_inline
01867 void
01868 Cube_aux::prefix_pp(Cube<eT>& x)
01869   {
01870         eT* memptr = x.memptr();
01871   const u32 n_elem = x.n_elem;
01872 
01873   for(u32 i=0; i<n_elem; ++i)
01874     {
01875     ++(memptr[i]);
01876     }
01877   }
01878 
01879 
01880 
01881 //! prefix ++ for complex numbers (work around for limitations of the std::complex class)
01882 template<typename T>
01883 arma_inline
01884 void
01885 Cube_aux::prefix_pp(Cube< std::complex<T> >& x)
01886   {
01887   x += T(1);
01888   }
01889 
01890 
01891 
01892 //! postfix ++
01893 template<typename eT>
01894 arma_inline
01895 void
01896 Cube_aux::postfix_pp(Cube<eT>& x)
01897   {
01898         eT* memptr = x.memptr();
01899   const u32 n_elem = x.n_elem;
01900 
01901   for(u32 i=0; i<n_elem; ++i)
01902     {
01903     (memptr[i])++;
01904     }
01905   }
01906 
01907 
01908 
01909 //! postfix ++ for complex numbers (work around for limitations of the std::complex class)
01910 template<typename T>
01911 arma_inline
01912 void
01913 Cube_aux::postfix_pp(Cube< std::complex<T> >& x)
01914   {
01915   x += T(1);
01916   }
01917 
01918 
01919 
01920 //! prefix --
01921 template<typename eT>
01922 arma_inline
01923 void
01924 Cube_aux::prefix_mm(Cube<eT>& x)
01925   {
01926         eT* memptr = x.memptr();
01927   const u32 n_elem = x.n_elem;
01928 
01929   for(u32 i=0; i<n_elem; ++i)
01930     {
01931     --(memptr[i]);
01932     }
01933   }
01934 
01935 
01936 
01937 //! prefix -- for complex numbers (work around for limitations of the std::complex class)
01938 template<typename T>
01939 arma_inline
01940 void
01941 Cube_aux::prefix_mm(Cube< std::complex<T> >& x)
01942   {
01943   x -= T(1);
01944   }
01945 
01946 
01947 
01948 //! postfix --
01949 template<typename eT>
01950 arma_inline
01951 void
01952 Cube_aux::postfix_mm(Cube<eT>& x)
01953   {
01954         eT* memptr = x.memptr();
01955   const u32 n_elem = x.n_elem;
01956 
01957   for(u32 i=0; i<n_elem; ++i)
01958     {
01959     (memptr[i])--;
01960     }
01961   }
01962 
01963 
01964 
01965 //! postfix ++ for complex numbers (work around for limitations of the std::complex class)
01966 template<typename T>
01967 arma_inline
01968 void
01969 Cube_aux::postfix_mm(Cube< std::complex<T> >& x)
01970   {
01971   x -= T(1);
01972   }
